reviews.text: In simple terms the outdoor items are falling apart due weather wear and tear. The indoor exhibits are good and as you through the building you will be surprised the size and depth of the building. Not much in the English translation but planes tell a lot. For a museum the indoor exhibits are very good. But the outdoor looks like a scrap yard or dumping ground for old decommissioned equipment. Worth a look but do not expect miracles. For what you pay it is fair.

You can see here helicopters, fighter jets and old memorabilia connected to aviation history. There are 2 large hangars in which the exhibits are well kept, the stuff that is kept outside could use a new repainting. You can easily spend an hour or two here. Worth a visit if you can get there, it's a bit off the beaten track for tourists. This time off the year it's open from 9 to 15:30 with 14:30 last entry. Tickets cost 10 Ron for adults and  half for children, the soldier at the gate said my daughter could enter free of charge.

They have some very interesting aircraft, but they need to be restored and properly displayed. It seems to be like a communist era museum. Needs to be more interactive. Needs a coffee shop and a gift shop. Great potential for a very attractive museum but investment is needed.
It's beautiful and you can learn a lot about Romania's airplanes history.

Interesting Old museum with a range of old planes (MIG's) from WW2 (and not only) that needs a larger place for a proper exibition of those. We have a history also in aviation and we need to share this with the people. I just found out, visiting the museum, that we had women's in aviation and mens that were pioneers frying a certain type of plane. Why this is not shared in local news..?!? This museum is also not known to the public. It's not so great as the museums in other countries but he exists and needs investments to continue to exist. The planes from outside area are left to die, needs a little paint. They are lovely to see, and must confess that i didn't saw those in other museums from around the world. Some new helicopters outside that we see also at Bias. Worth to mention that some of the explanations are also in english. What is inside hangar  needs english translation, because the info is very interesting, explaining a day in live of an aviator. It will help if the museum would have some interactive parts..maybe leave the simulators to be touched and tried by the public. Also, not only the planes needs explanation, you can add other interesting facts, stories from the military and aviation personnel.
Disappointingly small and not focused enough on the migration of the Serbs, interaction with other Slavic / Balkan cultures. On the other hand, super inexpensive (~$4USD
A great collocation of national heritage and costumes of all regions! Recommended for Slavists especially!
This museum was recently renovated. We visited 2 weeks ago and loved it.
Beautiful.different periods of culture,life,.on english too.water,toilet,very important.

This museum has clothes, tools, furniture, and recreations of living spaces of Serbian people from the past. They're still working on exhibits today so it's not fully functional completely right now but there are still many things to see in the upper levels.

Super neat market square to visit. You can feed pigeons outside and sit down for a bite to eat in multiple places. It is pretty touristy and a lot of the shops inside the hall are for tourists. There are horse rides and other little tour vehicles around to take you around this area. Lots of old buildings to see at this UNESCO World Heritage Site. Beautiful at night with all the lights!

Centre piece to this city square. Worth a walk through if you are there. Very attractive building.
Most of the stalls inside sell tourist souvenirs which are not my thing. 
Entrance to the underground city excavations can be found at one corner of this building. The excavations are very interesting and reviewed separately.

The Krakow Cloth Hall is a centrally located in Old Town and really easy to recognize it in the main market square. As per Wikipedia it was once a major centre of international trade and its listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1978.

It’s free to walk around, visit the market and galleries where you can buy amber jewelry, handcrafts and beautiful crystals, or you can just enjoy the beautiful details of the building.

You can also visit the upper floor, where there is a museum and looks nice a nice view of the central area, however we didn’t have time to visit it since we had one day in the city only.

Eli: 5  /  Serge: 5
 
Recommended: Yes, It’s a nice and central landmark of Krakow.

This is a very nice place to go on shopping if you don't care about your wallet.
It's nice, you'll find a lot of Amber based Jewlery, leather stuff handcrafted and wooden boxes.
It's cool but frankly, you are not going to miss that much.
The Square is nice. Some of the items in the shops are original and local. Some furs looked Canadian, though I didn't ask. People were pleasant.

This is a beautiful historic gateway and fortification from 14th century and it was the first place we saw while visiting Krakow old town because called our attention the huge walls in brick style. The gate has a tower really beautiful in details.

We just walked around the huge walls and we saw the entrance since we wouldn’t have time to visit inside, but you can find easily the prices and about the exhibitions that you can find inside on their official website and looks like you can even book in advance.

Eli: 4  /  Serge: 4
 
Recommended: Yes, it’s a beautiful place to visit around and if you have time should be worth to visit inside.
This place is just amazing when you look at this building you got feelings like you are in 15 century
Nice monument on the edge of the town stroll through the park
Beautifly kept part of old town walks

A brick fort made of bricks surrounded by a dry moat. Very nice to look at, unfortunately the museum was closed when I visited at about 5 pm. It is a popular spot since the Barbican is surrounded by a park and there are several food stands nearby for snacks and drinks.
This was the most amazing church I have seen so far.   The colours were simply breathtaking and the huge cross puts you into thinking mode.   A must see and my stand out moment.

It's a beautiful church (basilica to be more exact) located right at the city center. Might need to go there a bit early in the morning to get some good photos as the place get quite crowded very quickly.
There's a trumpet playing every hour or so.
Bought the ticket for a few zloties to go inside. It was very beautiful inside, however I was a bit disappointed as there are no English legends or explanations for the displays.

Gothic architecture, catholic church located on the Main Square in Krakow. Observe the restrictions when it comes to parts of the church / Basilika where photos are not allowed. Architecture is beautiful, spiritual / religious observation and experience is awesome.

This amazing Basilica in the heart of Krakow is a must to go in Krakow! You can visit a part of it for free, but you also can buy a cheap ticket to have full access. Every detail deserve your attention, one of the most beautiful altars I have seen.
Nice church. The interior is very ornate and atmospheric. I wouldn't say that church is outstanding, but anyway it worth visiting. There are an entrance fee for tourists (about 10 zl?)
This was the most amazing church I have seen so far.   The colours were simply breathtaking and the huge cross puts you into thinking mode.   A must see and my stand out moment.

It's a beautiful church (basilica to be more exact) located right at the city center. Might need to go there a bit early in the morning to get some good photos as the place get quite crowded very quickly.
There's a trumpet playing every hour or so.
Bought the ticket for a few zloties to go inside. It was very beautiful inside, however I was a bit disappointed as there are no English legends or explanations for the displays.

Gothic architecture, catholic church located on the Main Square in Krakow. Observe the restrictions when it comes to parts of the church / Basilika where photos are not allowed. Architecture is beautiful, spiritual / religious observation and experience is awesome.

This amazing Basilica in the heart of Krakow is a must to go in Krakow! You can visit a part of it for free, but you also can buy a cheap ticket to have full access. Every detail deserve your attention, one of the most beautiful altars I have seen.
Nice church. The interior is very ornate and atmospheric. I wouldn't say that church is outstanding, but anyway it worth visiting. There are an entrance fee for tourists (about 10 zl?)
It is a holy place by Mother  Mary......
A spiritual place, good ambience
Awsome
I was there for a marriage function. A beautiful church.
This is my own parish 😍😍 I really happy to live near my church
The name of one of Jesus Grandmother's, Mary's Mother, and a lovely Church.
Great to see in person.
Beautiful church.  Worth a short detour.

From wiki

The architect was a Polonized Dutchman Tylman van Gameren, a chief architect at the court of John III Sobieski. The interior stucco decoration is the work of Baldassarre Fontana, and the polychromy assisted by painters and brothers Carlo and Innocente Monti and Karl Dankwart of Nysa. The painting of St. Anne in the high altar is the work of Jerzy Siemiginowski-Eleuter, court painter of King John III Sobieski. The 18th-century paintings in the stalls showing the life of Saint Anne are by Szymon Czechowicz. In the transept there is an altar of the adoration of the cross to the left, and the tomb of John Cantius to the right.

This astounding church has a much lighter feel than some of the others, with lighter paintings throughout the domes. Look especially at the plaster work, which often creeps outside the borders of where the image is supposed to be, making the scenes feel like they're approaching you in 3D.

We visited this small church while walking exploring the streets of Kraow Old town and even though it was not in our schedule we decided to go inside and we really liked it. It’s a simple church compared to the main Basilica of Krakow, but has nice details of a Baroque style and it’s peaceful and quiet inside. We didn’t pay entrance fees.

Eli: 4  /  Serge: 4
 
Recommended: Yes, it’s a nice and peaceful church to visit.

The church itself is amazing and beatiful. 
Everyday they also host a concert at 08PM though you have to buy a ticket for it. But it's definitely worth every zloty.
The players were very skillful, especially the violin players. They were really passionate with their playing.
Not so in love with the pianist though. :\
Beautiful church . Oh what a amazing concert. Really really enjoyed the concert
If you're regilous this is definitely for you ....but still a wonderful place to visit
Every night at 20:00 nice concert fot turists.
The only church in KRK with english mass every Sunday @ 10.30 am. Also has a great international community.

Definitely not a tourist magnet, this small church with unassuming entrance. Easy to miss, even though situated right behind the Wawel. Perhaps this is because of limited opening times. I was lucky to be there during mass at 12AM, so I could have a look afterwards and make a few snaps.
Small but very beatiful church in city centre!

This is a nice and beautiful church to come too...
I like to walk around this church and it is also so near the Wawel
Nice place.
Very nice church, like the calvary of Christ statues at the back of the church.
Jeden z wielu starych kościołów które trzeba odwiedzić gdy się jest w Krakowie
Zajrzałem do środka przez szybkę. To dużo, zważywszy na to, że w wielu przypadkach w wielu kościołach oprócz budowli jako takiej mogłem jedynie podziwiać drzwi z zewnątrz.
Warty obejrzenia!
Piękny, stary, kameralny kościół. Trafiłam na piękną mszę i wspaniałą modlitwę po komunii.

Any NGO is there?? One of my friend's uncle who have been lost since 2012 is found on an NGO." St Holy cross " has writeen over the tshirt of that NGO. So i just want to confirm is there any link between that ngo or this church??. If any one knows something about that church or  ngo plz contact me.
A nice small church surrounded with houses
Parish for T.Nagar residents.

Hello All, I am visitor from Kolkata and will be in Chennai on Sunday 25th March,2018 which is Palm Sunday, I would be staying in Cenotaph Road, in-front of Moopnar Flyover, Can some one please let me know as to which Catholic Church is near to this place and I can attend the Service in the Evening please
Good place for worship

The church with one of the best paintings. The glass painting is of God creating earth with all the elements. Only the face of the god is that of the best who used to sit outside the church and was not allowed inside.

I really admire the way the painter gave a brilliant perspective to everyone.
Another beautiful basilica in Krakow located close to the main square of Krakow. If you are a big fan of the Pope Francisco you have to visit.
Wonderful art nouveau stained glass windows by the famous Wyspiański. A gem!
Beautiful place. Must see while visit
Beautiful art nouveau interior, a must see!
Very interesting tour to historical university places

A really nice place to visit.  Everyone comes to see the courtyard clock chime on the hour and there are several free permanent exhibits but you should definitely sign up for the tour.  You will only see a handful of rooms but they have really interesting things to see including scientific instruments used by Copernicus.  We really enjoyed the tour.
Not to be missed tourist attraction. Highly recommended

This historic university building is well worth an afternoon. While the tour was short, and ultimately only goes through a handful of rooms, it was very informative, and helps you to grasp the significance of this place. The ornate art and architecture, inside and out, as well as the collection of artifacts and precious objects is astounding for a university. Nicholas Copernicus' time at the university is explained, as is the interesting way of life of the early university professors.
The tours are limited in size, and are only available certain times of the day in English. They also only take cash as payment.
While the tourbooks all recommend coming on the uneven hours to see the mechanical clock, this particular element seems overrated (though entertaining), especially considering that it is not original and has been rebuilt several times.

Very nice building. Well preserved. The guide was friendly and knew a lot about the place. The museum is smaller than other major museums (like Rynek Underground) so it's not very crowded. There are many nice artifacts to see, including an authentic Oscar prize statue and a Nobel prize. It's worth a visit!

Super neat market square to visit. You can feed pigeons outside and sit down for a bite to eat in multiple places. It is pretty touristy and a lot of the shops inside the hall are for tourists. There are horse rides and other little tour vehicles around to take you around this area. Lots of old buildings to see at this UNESCO World Heritage Site. Beautiful at night with all the lights!

Centre piece to this city square. Worth a walk through if you are there. Very attractive building.
Most of the stalls inside sell tourist souvenirs which are not my thing. 
Entrance to the underground city excavations can be found at one corner of this building. The excavations are very interesting and reviewed separately.

The Krakow Cloth Hall is a centrally located in Old Town and really easy to recognize it in the main market square. As per Wikipedia it was once a major centre of international trade and its listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1978.

It’s free to walk around, visit the market and galleries where you can buy amber jewelry, handcrafts and beautiful crystals, or you can just enjoy the beautiful details of the building.

You can also visit the upper floor, where there is a museum and looks nice a nice view of the central area, however we didn’t have time to visit it since we had one day in the city only.

Eli: 5  /  Serge: 5
 
Recommended: Yes, It’s a nice and central landmark of Krakow.

This is a very nice place to go on shopping if you don't care about your wallet.
It's nice, you'll find a lot of Amber based Jewlery, leather stuff handcrafted and wooden boxes.
It's cool but frankly, you are not going to miss that much.
The Square is nice. Some of the items in the shops are original and local. Some furs looked Canadian, though I didn't ask. People were pleasant.

Set in Mehoffera's town house I really enjoyed this visit. Furniture and paintings set out pretty much as they would have been when the family lived there. Was expecting something more akin to a museum but felt very natural. 
Helpful staff and information boards about the pictures and other artefacts.
Visit took me an hour and a half. One for the artist or historian rather than a casual visit but good non the less. Not a place kids can run about due to the openness of the exhibits.
Place to visit  very intereteresting art and delicious restaurant cafe in de garden
Both the house and the collection are amazing. Also, nice garden. I was lucky to visit at Sunday, day with free entrance.
Charming museum, wonderful people, interesting events.
Small and cozy museum about the artist and his friends.

We had a really good visit. As a family, we have travelled around many different museums in Poland and this is definitely one of the best in the country.

The exhibits are all set up really well and there are English translations for everything. My children (5 and 10) really enjoyed the visit. We spent about 2hours there but we could have stayed longer.

incredible museum, well done and interesting. friendly and well-trained staff, a story told perfectly even with the help of videos and beautiful reconstructions of environments such as the goldsmith's or blacksmith's huts. interactive and full of things to discover. I highly recommend to visit it, just cost of 16 zt / 4 euros

great idea and implementation of museum in ruins underground and incorporating livelihoods of traders through ruins. However the videos at the end provided I believe the most amount of useful interesting info about Krakow, by then one is kinda tired of the other  bits on offer. All the space and interactive visuals were lost on me. Signage was for midgets and lighting to read them was atrocious. Curatours have clearly not walked around museum once it was open.
I really like this place. A lot of interesting things to see. This is the place about history of Krakow from the very beginning of the city existence
Quality place need advertising better so people no about it . It's a must visit place for me

The design of the museum is really fancy and nice but the organisation is not logical at all. First there are ‘things’ they show you as said in another review without real context and very difficult words to describe them. The readable texts were not enlightened and too low to read. Then at the end you have about 5(!) rooms with videos of about 10 minutes describing the background of all ages in Krakow!
This is an amazing place with lots to see. We spent several hours here. Tickets need to be bought in advance and there's a lovely coffee shop at the end of the trip

Horrible layout. You can walk around for an hour and a half looking at a lot of stuff, but there's no context. It's just stuff. At the very end there are videos about the city's history which might have helped me appreciate the stuff or at least give it some context, but by the time I got there it was almost closing time. Those videos should be first. There was also an "180 degree experience" that was essentially like watching a screensaver for 5 minutes. I kept waiting for the real movie to start... Awful. Put the videos on a loop there.
Really good underground museum. It is under Krakow's main square. The ticket is really cheap but worth to know this hidden place :)
Absolutely incredible- well worth a visit. We spent 3-4 hours there and would recommend it to anyone.
Wonderful place and new experience

Small but nice. Its quite nice considering the size of Bergamo. The ticket costs 3€, which includes admission to the natural science museum. All written signs are in italian but i think there are audio guides.
It is very old and the exposition has seen a better days, but as the entrance is free why not to come in...
Tiny, tiny museum. But together with museum of natural history (which is much bigger, and share the same 3 euro ticket) is ok.
Piccolo Museo incentrato sulla storia locale con diversi reperti delle varie epoche ritrovati nel territorio bergamasco, soprattutto romani.

Best place to visit . It is found inside Addis Ababa university , College of natural and computational science compound .
Several wild animals are found reserved ( killed and dried ) 
It has entrance fee 
For regular students (AAU students ) and children - 5 birr
For adult Ethiopians - 15 birr
For foreigners - 100 birr 
If you want to record and take a picture you have to pay another fee .
But all the payments are totally worth it .
I RECOMMEND YOU TO VISIT THIS PLACE .
Museum was closed despite that it's supposed to be opened.  No explanations.  Don't bother going.
It is consist of historical and inspire objects.
Easy to miss. Still worth a walk through for the insect and mammal collections, modest though they are. Gives a sense of the biological  diversity of the country.

Fantastic contemporary art exhibition commenting on current day Poland.
Thanks for insightful conversation  with anthropology ( yes it is definitely a science in most free thinking countries) student in attendance.
If you like contemporary art

The exhibition is fantastic, 5/5 stars. Really high quality art.
Unfortunately they don't have functioning AC in the building. 31C with high humidity is not a good climate to apreciate art.
Very interesting place
Also a great cafe!
Beautiful classic theater 🎭. Like it. They translate part of the play. 21€ for a perfect view. Just book online.
Amazing teathre. It's really worth visiting
Legendary, old theater in Cracow, jest plays nad unforgatable shows
So wonderful place with incredible interior!

Designed by Jan Zawiejski, the theatre was erected on Holy Ghost Square (Plac Św. Ducha) in place of the former 14th century church and monastery of religious order 'Duchacy' or Order of the Holy Ghost (hence the name of the square). The church had been converted into a residential building due to secularization of the Polish male branch of the cloister in 1783. The city council of Kraków decided to demolish it in 1886 in order to make room for a new theatre. The church was dismantled in May 1892 – an event which caused much controversy, notably the emotive declaration of Polish painter Jan Matejko, that he would never exhibit his paintings in Kraków again.

The new theatre opened on October 21, 1893. It was an exquisite example of the Polish Eclectic architecture, the first building in Kraków designed for and equipped with electric light. Initially it was called Municipal Theatre (Teatr Miejski). Only in 1909 did it receive the name of Juliusz Słowacki, a Polish poet and playwright of Romanticism.

Inauguration took place with a program consisting of excerpts from Aleksander Fredro's Zemsta, Juliusz Słowacki's Balladyna and Adam Mickiewicz's Konfederaci Barscy. The theatre staged its first full-length production, Fredro's Śluby Panieńskie, four days later.

During Nazi Germany occupation of Poland, the theatre was run by a German troupe. The last Polish play for the next 6 years was produced in Autumn 1939. The theatre reopened for Polish audience in February 1945.

Since March 27, 1976, the theatre is accompanied by the Small Stage housed in the former electric plant (designed in 1890s, to provide the theatre with its own electricity). In 2000 a third stage was added, the summertime Next to the Pump Stage. A fourth one (Stage in the Gate) opened on November 7, 2003.
Super modern theatre, well organised, and great staff. (Rating as a performer, not a visitor)
Nice cinema, even more during Krakow film festival !
Modern theater, comfortable for an audience
Beautiful modern place of art. Plus restaurant.
Cool place

Ladies you are perfect.
Perfect place which is decorated old style and the food was really really amazing. And the prices are very affordable. Try them!
Nice atmosphere, good food and great value of money. Family friendly.
Quite good polish cuisine for affordable price
We couldn’t get enough. Save room for dessert and try the pear with chocolate!
Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but the service was somewhat slow and the waitress looked bored with her job.
Great decor and atmosphere! If you want to eat not very expensive but close to the main square this is it! Don’t be surprised if you hear live piano music...

If you are a tourist in Krakow and don't really know typical polish places to eat in then this is it ! You should definitely visit this place where the food is tasty and comes in a huge variety.. the ambiance is really authentic and makes you enjoy the food even more! Don't leave Krakow missing this place.

Lived this place. Great local food, big portions, big variety and low prices. The atmosphere is kind of "eat and go away" but this is a place to eat, and go away, not for an evening out with friends. Food is great. Enjoy.

The place is pretty.
The prices are good.
The food well it was fresh but I didn't got thrilled with the taste.
The stuff was simple not rude but with the big problem of their bad English so they couldn't explain the dishes they were selling and I couldn't order with knowing what I was actually going to eat...

Very nice ambience, especially the upstairs tables. They even have live piano music. The food is average, overseasoned, but the prices are very reasonable. I'd come again for a drink, not food though.

Cozy little resto, with great breakfast and lunch options, good coffee and pleasant vibe.
We've had great fresh squeezed juices (try carrot!), coffee (they also serve delicious spiced coffee with cardamon etc), dumplings and burrito. All tasted great and fresh. Burritos are my thing and I really like the way they make it here. They add polish style salads to every dish and at first we thought of skipping it, but then we tried some and they were surprisingly good.
The service is fast and friendly.

These people are the proof that a good meal doesn’t require meat! Clean place with friendly staff!

The concept is that you order a main dish at the clerk and add 2 (different) salads that are presented behind the glass. Take your salads, grab your cutlery and have a seat. In the meantime the chef prepares your meal and when it’s finished they will call you. Enjoy! And don’t forget to bring back the empty plates to the front :) 

I usually find vegetarian food a bit boring but we had the russian style pierogis and burrito and it was absolutely amazing!

Nice vegan/vegetarian restaurant for great prices! The portion is also large. Had cheese kofta with paprika sauce. The food is presented nice and the ambiance of the place itself is great!

Will definitely recommend!
Vegan food selfservice bar. Good food at modest prices. Ample space to eat in. Opportunity to meet interesting folks. Very close to main atractions also walking distance from the railway station.

I had a vegan curry and I found the proportion of the curry to the buckewheat a little small. Although both were good, the buckwheat was really tasty but I would prefer a little less and a little more curry. Not so many options of vegan salads. The concept is really nice though and the food was made fast.

I don't understand reason of opening restaurant if you do not want to serve your guests. After waiting for over 10 minutes for any reaction from the personnel (there were 3 people behind the bar-only one was preparing something- and not much clients) I left. Seriously? Is it such an effort to bring the menu to the table and ask guest to wait for being serve? I strongly recommend to pick other place.
Amazing food, great atmosphere and the live music was a perfect accompaniment.

A concept restaurant offering what appears to be rustic medieval Polish food, but actually is somewhat refined. Two incidents were of concern: (1) we were promised a specific reserved table, but they didn’t honor this promise when we arrived (we were given an alternative table); (2) I showed the waiter a picture of an entree from their website, but he couldn’t tell me which item it was on their menu (so their website may not reflect the actual offerings). After getting past those concerns, the food was sincerely good and large in portions. We had the veal shank and the pork with roasted vegetables. Wine by-the-glass matched the food and was also provided in ample portions to last the meal. There was live entertainment: an American-style Jazz/pop singer with guitar player.
Great cousine and service!
Great place to eat, fun atmosphere great service and food. We sat outside on the corner on a beautiful summer evening and did some awesome people watching while enjoying great food and polish beer!
Every thing was perfect .room first class .staff were just fantastic warm and friendly. The staff made our holiday very special. Thank you all so much.
100% amazing.... Rooms, views over the square, breakfast great, staff friendly and helpful.
Amazing hotel with very friendly and helpful staff looking out on the main square. Perfect.
Excellent hotel. Staff is Awesome, fluent in English and extremely helpful. Rooms are beautiful and clean

Luxury hotel in the heart of old town. Very well designed bedrooms with comfortable bed.  Wonderful views to the amazing old town architecture. A Girlfriend-visits friendly hotel. Lovely cartoon alike surroundings. Many restaurants and bars around. This place has it's flair in all 4 seasons of the year - something to be appreciated and long remembered.
Every thing was perfect .room first class .staff were just fantastic warm and friendly. The staff made our holiday very special. Thank you all so much.
100% amazing.... Rooms, views over the square, breakfast great, staff friendly and helpful.
Amazing hotel with very friendly and helpful staff looking out on the main square. Perfect.
Excellent hotel. Staff is Awesome, fluent in English and extremely helpful. Rooms are beautiful and clean

Luxury hotel in the heart of old town. Very well designed bedrooms with comfortable bed.  Wonderful views to the amazing old town architecture. A Girlfriend-visits friendly hotel. Lovely cartoon alike surroundings. Many restaurants and bars around. This place has it's flair in all 4 seasons of the year - something to be appreciated and long remembered.
Hundreds of people. Walking, running, skating, biking. Beautiful Sunday time.
Very parkly park. You gotta love all the trees.
Very nice place to take fresh air and play outdoor games & activities (freesbee, roller, skateboard...). Also #Parkrun Krakow.
One of my fav spots in Krakow..  all seasons
Took part in the Krakow parkrun here. Great flat course. No PB though, weather was not in my favour.
Beautiful area with a great views of the city. Nice place a picnic. Just as info no shops around. The closest at zoo entrance. Not accessible by car, so not that croudy.

Great views from the top of the mountain, the walk across the forest is simply perfect, great trees, nature in the purest form. 
It is always surrounded by good people having a good time with family, friends or just walking their dogs. Don't forget to visit it if you are on a trip to Krakow!!
Nice memorial place in the nature.
You have to be rather sporty to climb the Mound hill. I would recommend to visit the place on foot, not by bike, as you might get exhausted. The view is nice, but Krakow city is far, as for me

Great view on the entire city and neighbourhoods. You can recognize the most of Krakow's prominent churches. You may also see Beskidy and Tatras in south when visibility is high. In north there is Krakow-Czestochowa upland observed, which is made of limestones mostly.

Nice zoo, took a couple of hours to walk around, very friendly, could of done with a guide and animal descriptions in English. But all in all a very very nice zoo and they had a baby jaguar. Animals very active, lovely to see.

This zoo is okay, we visited it in the winter. There weren't a lot of animals visible, but enough to enjoy it for a couple of hours. Also some animals are inside which you can view. The monkeys/apes are in small cages ☹️ but most of the animals have good places to live. Make sure to bring some cash, because you cannot use your card when you want to have a drink.
Very good selection of animals. It also appears they are making some really good changes. I can't wait to go back in a year and see what changes have been made.
A great day had by all and well worth a visit whenever coming to Krakow.  £6 in an uber to the zoo and £3 to get in. It took us about 4 hours at a leisurely pace.  Highly recommended.
A great escape from the city and you can see the improvements being made for the animals. Plenty of space so even though there were lots of people when we visited it didn't feel crowded In any way.
This gallery always has a lot to offer but the park and area around is even more unique, some would say “creepy” but i would say “expect unexpected!”
Chromego dziela zawsze warto ogladnac, nawet parę razy.
Warto tam być, każdy oceni sam.
Wspaniałe miejsce w otoczeniu zieleni
Ciekawe miejsce ze sporą ilością sztuki

Great museum. Not that massive for a national museum. 
A couple of specialty exhibitions but otherwise a comprehensive display of polish artefacts. Nicely displayed. 
Some really interesting beautiful pieces.
Worth a visit.

Decent, but not overwhelmingly impressive for a national museum. Well curated, and when translated into English (which is only about half the time) it is very beautifully done. The current Da Vinci installation is so well-written that one may mistake it for literature...or nearly so.

A must see in this beautiful city, not only for the Lady with an Ermine. 
It speaks for all polish people, representing their fascinating culture and history with paintings, books, very rare objects exc. I don't wanna spoiler anything, come and see!
Loved it! Especially the permanent display of da Vinci's "Lady with an ermine". Good display of the local artists, good facilities in general but wish cafe was bigger.

Very nice museum, too bad some of the staff doesn't speak English. Also there's a spelling mistake on the exhibition of guns and clothing on the ground floor. It says "Became a Knight" instead of "Become a Knight".

Complicated museum layout but worth the effort to visit if the subject is of interest. I'm not sure if they expect to get many non Polish visitors. Although it is a modern museum the approach to the museum is a bit run down and seems to be more of an unofficial car park so if approaching on foot you will need to persevere.

Most rarely visited museum in Krakow. Well maintained and beautiful. Have lots of weapons on display and have well preserved history. I loved this place for its detailed description of Polish history in military and the medals awarded for the bravery of a soldier.

this museum is very informative and has a vast collection of decommissioned fire arms yp stairs but the down stairs of the museum is a bit of a maze and is easy to get los in ps if your from the uk do not buy tge bullets for memorabilia as you will not get through customs with them at all

Almost impossible to find, after finding what I can only assume was the ticket office (no sign, just a window) a man barked ‘closed’ at me. It was advertised as open and the car park was filled with coaches so I don’t understand why. Absolutely terrible experience.
Very interesting, modern, worth-visiting museum.

Picked up some take out. I had the Mongolian Beef with steamed rice and hot & sour soup. The soup was delicious and on the spicy side. Rice was nice and fluffy and I asked for a little cup of the “red sweet/sour sauce” as I like to put it on the rice. They were happy to accommodate my request.
The Mongolian Beef was outstanding! It was still piping hot when I opened the carton at home. The meat was tender and full of flavor. Best I’ve had in town. Will definitely order from them again.

I have a very mixed opinion of this place. Im giving three stars only because the food is always great, fresh, etc which is why I keep going back. HOWEVER, the service in house is subpar. Staff always seems frustrated that you are there and it takes FOREVER to get your food. So only go if you are not in a hurry to be anywhere soon. As far as calling in, good luck. That’s hit or miss. Some days I can get an answer and other days I never am able to get anyone to pick up the phone, and yes- I am calling during their funky business hours. Also, if you call in, still expect it to take at least 30 minutes or more for your food to be ready to be picked up.
Food not to bad.
We love this place. Been following that s business for over 20 years.
Nice Thai food, and inexpensive.
